benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Add custom fields to bundle

covered: POST Valid Payload: TC01, TC03, TC04 cover successful creation paths with valid bundle and payload.
POST Invalid Payload: TC08 (malformed JSON), TC09 (empty body) and TC10 (invalid schema) cover various invalid payload scenarios.
POST Validation: TC10 (schema validation errors), TC11 (duplicate field names in same request), TC12 (unsupported fields in request) cover input validation and error reporting.
Authorization: TC14 (Unauthorized access) covers missing/invalid token.
Server Error Handling: TC15 (503 service unavailable) and TC06 (404 bundle not found) cover some error responses; TC04 also implies handling existing data during creation.
Security: TC23 (SQL injection attempt) and TC24 (XSS attempt) cover input sanitization/security concerns.
Performance/Scale: TC17 (Large payload) and TC22 (Concurrent requests) begin to address performance, responsiveness, and consistency under load.
Availability/Documentation: TC25 (Accessibility of API docs) touches ancillary documentation accessibility.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling for large datasets (not typically relevant for POST create, but guideline item exists).
Rate Limiting: No tests to verify how the API behaves under bursty or rate-limited conditions.
Caching Behavior: No tests checking for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) or related caching behavior.
Duplicate Submission: No explicit test for idempotent handling or duplicate POST submissions across separate requests (only field-name duplicates within a single payload are tested in TC11).
500 Internal Server Error: No explicit test simulating a 500 error (DB failure or unexpected server error) beyond 503/service-unavailable scenarios.
Integration/Dependency Failures: TC20 covers a dependent service for bundle lookup being unavailable (good), but broader 500-level dependency failures are not exhaustively tested.
Regression/Specification Conformance: TC21 mentions field-name casing but leaves behavior to latest spec; more precise coverage may be needed to confirm exact casing rules across services.
recommendations: Add explicit rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure proper handling of bursts and to validate retry/backoff behavior.
Add caching tests to verify presence and correctness of caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) where applicable.
Introduce 500 Internal Server Error tests to simulate database or internal failures (e.g., 500 with error details, ensuring proper masking of sensitive info).
Add a test for duplicate submissions to verify idempotency or graceful handling of repeated identical requests (e.g., same payload posted twice).
Consider pagination-related or volume-driven scenarios only if the API surface truly involves large lists or responses; for POST this is less typical but align with guideline if applicable.
Enhance TC21 to explicitly define the expected behavior for field name casing (e.g., enforce case sensitivity or normalization) to avoid ambiguity.
Optionally include additional security tests (e.g., more varied SQLi/XSS payloads, boundary values) and ensure all leverage the latest input validation rules.
